summary: Will the limelight make you or break you? Celebrities come and go, but LA County will always be  H O M E. Famed Status is a...
caption:
Will the limelight make you or break you? Celebrities come and go, but LA County will always be  H O M E.

Famed Status is a semi-plotless celebrity based rpg. This group moves in real time. Relationships and timeline events are up to each player. The only set plot is their home is somewhere within LA County. Everyone is free to travel, leave for work, or the spontaneous road-trip cross country! Come check us out today!

MAIN / RULES / APP  / TAKEN / MOST WANTED / NAVI

summary: Rumor: Disney President Bob Iger Considers Firing Lucasfilm Head Kathleen Kennedy
title: Rumor: Disney President Bob Iger Considers Firing Lucasfilm Head Kathleen Kennedy
body:
Rumor: Disney President Bob Iger Considers Firing Lucasfilm Head Kathleen Kennedy

The Rumor Mill is at It Again

Solo: A Star Wars Story didn’t do so well at the box office. It’s the first box office bomb with a Star Wars label on it. It’s an unfortunate truth that is at the core of so many rumors these days. Quite a few fans were upset about Star Wars: The Last Jedi, and the box office results for Solo: A Star Wars Story are lackluster, and now a number of “insiders” are…

View On WordPress

blog.name: e-louise-bates
blog.title: Whitney & Davies Investigations
blog.description: Official Tumblr of E.L. Bates, aka Louise. Originally designed to be strictly related to my Whitney & Davies book series, now a conglomeration of all things I find interesting or beautiful....

question: For the character ask: Rey
answer:
Rey: hate them | don’t really care | like them | LOVE them | THEY ARE MY PRECIOUS

ship with:  Honestly, I am indifferent to romance in Rey’s life (I am not opposed to her ending up with a redeemed Ben Solo and I think that would be an awesome storyline, but personally I don’t care that much about them one way or the other)

friendship them with: Rose. I know they haven’t met yet, but they would be AMAZING friends and I really want to see that happen. 

general opinions: Rey is awesome, and I love her blend of idealism and pragmatism, and I think the throne room fight scene in TLJ is probably the best lightsaber fight in all the SW movies.

An account of investigations into the unknown and then confrontation of the evil found in the abyss.

More specifically, this is a collection of memorable quotes from my gaming group's sessions.

Common games include Call of Cthulhu, Pathfinder, and Star Wars.

blog.name: lifelvesatragedy
blog.title: My World
blog.description: Welcome to my crazy world. ;) I am a writer, roleplayer, and fangirl extraordinaire. I love to read, write, listen to music, and watch movies. I obsess over the things I like.

title: Introductions
body:
Lando wasn’t entirely sure why he was here. Actually, he was quite sure. He was here to watch the lovely ladies of the club dance up on the stage – and sometimes a few laps here and there – in order to please the men who came in for a little relaxing entertainment and perhaps a little more should all parties be willing. He wasn’t against entertainment himself, but he wasn’t a fan of paying for it in establishments like this when he could find willing entertainers just about everywhere he went. Ladies didn’t need the motivation of money to want to…entertain him. They were drawn to his good looks and charms without such things. But, that certainly didn’t mean he couldn’t look and enjoy. It wasn’t his first go round in places like this and worse. And sometimes they were impressive enough that such bonuses were earned.

As far as establishments like this went, Cloud Mine was one of the better ones in his city. The employees were treated as beings with rights and feelings and most of them seemed to enjoy what they were doing, or at least not to hate it. And they were fairly well compensated even without the bonuses of tips and…other luxuries.

He probably wouldn’t be here at all if his buddy hadn’t insisted on taking him out to somewhere real nice and relaxing for his birthday because ‘even Baron Administrators deserve a break from the humdrum of administrative duties now and then.’ And, really, that friend wasn’t wrong there. Being in charge of an entire city could be quite exhausting even for someone of his great intelligence and abilities and…who was he to turn down a bunch of pretty girls? Everyone deserved to earn a living after all, and these couldn’t do so without patrons to support them.

Tonight seemed to be quite the occasion as all of the performers were quite impressive. Lithe, smooth, cat-like in their agility, attractive and then some…it didn’t take long to have him thinking this was more than just a good idea after all. It was easy to tell which girls were the favorites as well as which men and women were frequent patrons.

When each set ended, the dancer would disappear backstage for a few minutes and either someone from the audience would disappear in that direction or the dancers would return to retrieve them or to try to woo whoever caught their interest. But, one girl didn’t do any of that. Oh, she disappeared to dress and fix herself up, but when she returned it wasn’t to any particular person. It was to the bar.

He couldn’t blame her. He supposed dancing must be thirsty work and sometimes one just needed a drink. He understood that much. A glance around showed that the friend who had talked him into coming – not that it had taken much effort to do so – was otherwise occupied, so he shrugged and lifted himself gracefully to his feet before making his way to the bar himself.

He watched her for a moment, head slightly tilted as he studied her. He didn’t leer or otherwise do anything to make her uncomfortable. He wasn’t a creep, after all. And when her shots were slid over, he placed a couple credits on the bar and offered a smile in greeting. “Those are on me.” He told the bartender, while keeping his eyes on the girl. They hadn’t officially met, but he had seen her before. And, if she had seen him, she surely remembered him. He was rather hard to forget.

He turned to lean against the bar so that his back was to it and he was facing the girl. “I imagine such artistic ability as you displayed up there under the harsh lights that couldn’t possibly come anywhere close to matching your beauty is thirsty work.” He commented with another smile. “Such things should be enhanced with starlight or sunshine, something that brings out the raw talent and canvas.” He paused for a moment. “Have you ever danced under the starlight, Kavra?” They hadn’t met, but she had been announced before her dance and he had heard of her anyway. “Have you ever danced for the pure enjoyment of dancing and not the credits it might bring in?” He leaned a little closer. “You’re good, if you don’t mind a humble man like myself commenting on such, but you also seem to have a passion that some of the others don’t possess and that shines through in your performance. Color me intrigued.”

He blinked as if just realizing something and somehow managed to continue smirking while also looking somewhat abashed. “Pardon me. I suppose introductions are in order if I’m going to speak so frankly.” He reached for her hand, rubbing his thumb across her knuckles. “Lando Calrissian at your service.” He lifted that hand to his lips and kissed it while keeping his eyes on hers. “It’s a very great pleasure to meet you.”
